page.title: 09OIL PRODUCTS PIPELINE
page.content:
The 3M's pipeline links the refineries at{Milford Haven}to the densely populated areas in the {Midlands}and{Manchester.}It was constructed in{1972-3}by a consortium of Esso Petroleum Co., Gulf Oil Co. and Texaco Ltd. at a cost of Â£15 million. Esso's pipeline is now used by Amoco (UK) Ltd.. The pipeline carries a variety of {refined oil products,}especially petrol, kerosene and diesel fuel. The oils from the 3 refineries come in separate pipelines to a pumping station in Waterston. From there they are pumped along the{230km pipeline}to Seisdon in Staffordshire; they then are distributed to the main market areas.
by Andrew Cole
